intro: Catolobus pendulus, commonly known as the hanging catclaw, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its long, pendulous branches and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are usually small and alternate, and it produces small, hard pods containing seeds. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
